p: Using GCPS data, we selected participants who were 16â€“69 years old, not HIV-positive by self-report (i.e., HIV-negative or of unknown HIV status) and sexually active (i.e., having had at least one male sex partner in the six months before the survey). In this subsample, we identified men at high risk of acquiring HIV, defined by 2015 Australian PrEP guidelines [ 17]. The measurement of each high-risk criterion was approximated by the closest available GCPS indicator with respect to a specific practice or the reference period (see Table 1):
